titleInfo.title: Size Matters. Effects of Relative Distance on the Acceptability of Spatial Prepositions

originInfo.publisher: Centre for Cognition and Decision Making, Higher School of Economics

titleInfo.title: The 10th Annual Embodied and Situated Language Processing

bibliographicCitation.chicago: Kluth, Thomas, Burigo, Michele, Schultheis, Holger, and Knoeferle, Pia. 2017. “Size Matters. Effects of Relative Distance on the Acceptability of Spatial Prepositions”. In The 10th Annual Embodied and Situated Language Processing, ed. Anna Shestakova, Victoria Moiseeva, Andriy Myachykov, Yury Shtyrov, Beatriz Martín-Luengo, Mikhail Pokhoday, Elena Kulkova, and Anastasia Plotnikova, 26. Moscow, Russia: Centre for Cognition and Decision Making, Higher School of Economics.
